briefdescription.para: The EPEC nash game written as an LCP.
A Gurobi mode object of the LCP form of EPEC.

detaileddescription.para: A Gurobi mode object of the LCP form of EPEC. If we are searching for a pure NE, the LCP which is indifferent to pure or mixed NE is stored in this object.

briefdescription.para: The QP corresponding to each player.
Objective of each leader.
convex hull computation

detaileddescription.para: Objective of each leader, given the

briefdescription.para: The EPEC nash game.

detaileddescription.para: Number of variables in the current player, including any number of convex hull variables at the current moment. The used, i.e., the inheritor of Game::EPEC has the responsibility to keep this correct by implementing an override of Game::EPEC::updateLocations.

briefdescription.para: Solution equation values.
Solution variable values.
Warmstarts EPEC with a solution.
Empty function - optionally re-implementable in derived class.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be optionally implemented by the derived class. Code in this class will be run before calling Game::EPEC::finalize().

briefdescription.para: Empty function - optionally reimplementable in derived class.

detaileddescription.para: This function can be optionally implemented by the derived class. Code in this class will be run after calling Game::EPEC::finalize().

briefdescription.para: The leader to whom dummy variables should be added
Add Dummy variables for the leaders.

inbodydescription.para: Adds dummy variables to the leader of an EPEC - useful after computing the convex hull.

briefdescription.para: Makes the MathOpt::QP_Param corresponding to the i-th country.

listitem.para: First gets the Game::LCP object from Game::EPEC::PlayersLowerLevels and makes a MathOpt::QP_Param with this LCP as the lower level
This is achieved by calling LCP::makeQP and using the objective value object in Game::EPEC::LeaderObjective

Finally the locations are updated owing to the complete convex hull calculated during the call to LCP::makeQP
Overloaded as Models::EPEC::makePlayerQP()

briefdescription.para: Makes the MathOpt::QP_Param for all the countries.

detaileddescription.para:
Calls are made to Models::EPEC::makePlayerQP(const unsigned int i) for each valid i
Overloaded as EPEC::makePlayerQP(unsigned int)

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::vec &x, const unsigned int &i, arma::vec &solOther) const
memberdef.name: getXMinusI

briefdescription.para: True if we search for a PNE
Allowed time limit to run this function
If true, the Algorithm will seek for the maximum number of NE. Then, it will check they are equilibria for the original problem

inbodydescription.para:
Given that Game::EPEC::PlayersQP are all filled with a each country's MathOpt::QP_Param problem (either exact or approximate), computes the Nash equilibrium.
true if a Nash equilibrium is found

briefdescription.para: Finalizes the creation of a Game::EPEC object.

detaileddescription.para:
Performs a bunch of job after all data for a Game::EPEC object are given, namely. Models::EPEC::computeLeaderLocations - Adds the required dummy variables to each leader's problem so that a game among the leaders can be defined. Calls Game::EPEC::addDummyLead
Makes the market clearing constraint in each country. Calls

inbodydescription.para: Game::EPEC::preFinalize() can be overridden, and that code will run before calling Game::EPEC::finalize()
Game::EPEC::postFinalize() can be overridden, and that code will run after calling Game::EPEC::finalize()

briefdescription.para: The main method to start the solving process.

inbodydescription.para: Computes Nash equilibrium using the Algorithm set in Game::EPEC::Algorithm
Checks the value of Game::EPEC::Algorithm and delegates the task to appropriate Algorithm wrappers.

briefdescription.para: Return a bool true if the strategies are all pure, for any player.

inbodydescription.para: Call the delegated Algorithm and return true if the EPEC has been solved.

briefdescription.para: equilibrium is a pure strategy

detaileddescription.para: Return a bool indicating whether the

inbodydescription.para: Call the delegated Algorithm and return true if the equilibrium is pure

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned int i, const arma::vec &x) const
memberdef.name: respond

memberdef.argsstring: (arma::vec &sol, unsigned int player, const arma::vec &x, const arma::vec &prevDev={}) const
memberdef.name: respondSol

briefdescription.para: Optimal response
Player whose optimal response is to be computed
A std::vector of pure strategies (either for all players or all other players

inbodydescription.para: Returns the optimal objective value that is obtainable for the player player given the decision x of all other players.

Calls Game::EPEC::respond and obtains the std::unique_ptr to GRBModel of best response by player player. Then solves the model and returns the appropriate objective value.
The optimal objective value for the player player.

detaileddescription.para: Decides the Algorithm to be used for solving the given instance of the problem. The choice of algorithms are documented in Game::EPECalgorithm
Decides the Algorithm to be used for recovering a PNE out of the InnerApproximation procedure.

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int i, unsigned int j) const
memberdef.name: getPositionLeadFoll

inbodydescription.para: Get the position of the j-th variable in the i-th leader Querying Game::EPEC::LCPModel for x[return-value] variable gives the appropriate variable

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int i, unsigned int j) const
memberdef.name: getPositionLeadLead

inbodydescription.para: Get the position of the j-th Follower variable in the i-th leader Querying Game::EPEC::LCPModel for x[return-value] variable gives the appropriate variable

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int i, unsigned int j) const
memberdef.name: getValLeadFoll

inbodydescription.para: Get the value of the j-th variable in i-th leader

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int i, unsigned int j) const
memberdef.name: getValLeadLead

inbodydescription.para: Get the value of the j-th non-follower variable in i-th leader

detaileddescription.para: Get the Game::LCP object solved in the last iteration either to solve the problem or to prove non-existence of Nash equilibrium. Object is returned using constant reference.
Get the GRBModel solved in the last iteration to solve the problem or to prove non-existence of Nash equilibrium. Object is returned using constant reference.
Writes the GRBModel solved in the last iteration to solve the problem or to prove non-existence of Nash equilibrium to a file.

inbodydescription.para: Given the the solution x, the method returns in xWithoutHull the x vector without the convex-hull's variables. Also, no MC variables are included

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::vec &x, const unsigned int &i, arma::vec &solI, bool hull=false) const
memberdef.name: getXofI

inbodydescription.para: Given the player id i and the solution x, the method returns in xWithoutHull the x vector for the given player, with the convex-hull's variables in case hull is false. Also, no MC variables are included

briefdescription.para: Class to handle a Nash game between leaders of Stackelberg games.
